array.string: Five Forks: In Petersburg, Virginia, Confederate General Lee begins his final offensive.
The Rebel capital of Richmond, Virginia, falls to the Union, the most significant sign that the Confederacy is nearing its final days.

Robert E. Lee surrenders. In Appomattox Court House, Virginia, Confederate General Robert E. Lee surrenders his 28,000 troops to Union General Ulysses S. Grant, effectively ending the American Civil War.

President Abraham Lincoln is shot in the head at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C. The assassin, actor John Wilkes Booth, shouted, “Sic semper tyrannis! (Ever thus to tyrants!) The South is avenged,”
Last battle of the Civil War
The Battle of Palmito Ranch is considered by some criteria as the final battle of the American Civil War. The battle is recorded as a Confederate victory.
President Andrew Johnson officially declares the American Civil War to be ended.
